poem:
Title: Patterns in Reserve

Above all else, the Rate remains,
Unweaned from tempests of Change,
Unmoved—between 5.25 and 5.5,
steady as a heartless dial.

Inflation, the hound, sniffs the air,
Nibbles the edges of numbers.
But the Fed, like a gardener,
Uproots not the persistent weed,
Three percent stubbornly ascendant,
Keeps to its singular, stubborn 
Target – An unmoved heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US Federal Reserve holds interest rates steady as inflation ticks up The Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday that it is holding interest rates steady at 5.25% to 5.5%, their highest level in two decades, as inflation continues to dog the US economy. Though some had hoped the Fed would soon cut interest rates, which are at their highest level since 2007, the annual rate of inflation has stubbornly remained above 3%. The Fed’s target rate". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
